oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Using ab initio calculations all the components of the magnetic anisotropy in a dinuclear [(MnCuCl)-Cu-III-Cl-II(5-Br-sap)(2)(MeOH)] single-molecule magnet (SMM) have been computed. These calculations reveal that apart from the single-ion anisotropy, the exchange anisotropy also plays a crucial role in determining the sign as well as the magnitude of the cluster anisotropy. Developed magneto-structural correlations suggest that a large ferromagnetic exchange can in fact reduce the ground-state anisotropy, which is an integral component in the design of SMMs.
